title: LeBron saves day as putback at buzzer lifts L.A.

Byju, one of the researchers

content: The accused had killed his niece after she pressured him to marry her. He dumped her body in a drainage manhole, covering it with soil and cement in June 2023¬†

title: 1.5 lakh blooming tulips acts as good omen for Kashmir‚Äôs tourism sector
content: Located at an altitude of 5,600 feet, the Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden with Zabarwan Hills in the backdrop was curated by former Chief Minister Ghulam Nabi Azad

title: ‚ÄòP4‚Äô an ambitious initiative to achieve zero poverty in Andhra Pradesh by 2047
content: Andhra Pradesh launches ‚ÄòZero Poverty - P4 Policy‚Äô to eradicate poverty by 2047 through public-private partnerships

title: India caught in crossfire as Trump's 25% auto tariffs roil global supply chains
content: US President Donald Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on imported cars and auto parts, aimed at boosting domestic automotive manufacturing. This move could disrupt global supply chains, impacting India‚Äôs auto parts industry. Major Indian suppliers may need to explore new markets to counter the potential decline in US demand. Talks for a US-India bilateral trade agreement are ongoing.

title: 'Will badly affect Muslims': TN assembly passes resolution against Waqf bill
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin has urged the central government to withdraw the proposed Waqf amendment bill, stating it would negatively impact minority Muslims. The bill, which has not yet been introduced in the Lok Sabha, has sparked opposition due to concerns it would hinder the Waqf Board‚Äôs powers.

title: 'MS Dhoni doesn't react to ... ': Gukesh on how Dhoni shaped his chess career
content: Reigning world chess champion D Gukesh Dommaraju has named legendary cricketer MS Dhoni as his idol, admiring Dhoni's composure under pressure. Gukesh credits Dhoni's calmness and clear thinking in high-stakes situations for positively influencing his approach to handling pressure in his chess games. Recently, Gukesh spoke about his deep admiration for Dhoni and the significant role the cricketing icon has played in shaping his mindset and approach to pressure situations.

title: Bengaluru judge cites non-existent SC rulings to pass verdicts
content: The Karnataka high court has recommended action against a city civil judge in Bengaluru for referencing non-existent Supreme Court judgments in a ruling. The case involves plaintiffs who sought injunctions against lenders. The high court has asked for an investigation and appropriate action.

title: How to create Ghibli-style portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's new GPT-4o update has sparked a trend of Studio Ghibli-style portraits, exclusive to select ChatGPT subscription tiers. Despite the delay in the free-tier rollout, users can create similar artworks using free alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI, Craiyon, Artbreeder, and various premium platforms offering free trials.

title: Tiny Intruder: Child crawls through White House fence, quickly rescued
content: A young child breached the White House perimeter by crawling through the fencing near the North Lawn. Secret Service personnel quickly intervened and reunited the child with their parents without incident. This isn't the first such occurrence; a similar breach happened earlier in April 2023.

title: Encounter breaks out in J&K's Kathua, search operation launched
content: Security forces have cordoned off an area in J&K's Kathua district after terrorists were spotted. Reports indicate an exchange of fire occurred as forces initiated a search operation in the Ghati Juthana area. This search is part of an ongoing anti-terror effort that began four days ago.

title: Infosys to trainees amid Mysuru layoffs: You have not met the..."
content: Infosys has laid off 30-45 trainees at its Mysuru campus after they failed evaluation tests, continuing from a similar cut in February. Affected trainees have been offered alternative career paths and assistance with accommodations and transportation as needed. Infosys also modified its hybrid work policy, requiring employees to work from the office at least 10 days a month.

title: 'Putin will die soon,' says Zelenskyy amid Russia president's ill health rumors
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed Vladimir Putin is soon to die, as speculation about the Russian leader's health intensifies. Zelenskyy and French President Emmanuel Macron presented a unified stance, urging EU solidarity and increased military aid amidst ongoing conflicts and unreliable ceasefire agreements.

title: 'Will chop you, seal you in drum': UP woman threatens alcoholic husband
content: A woman from Meerut threatened her alcoholic husband with dismemberment if he didn't change his behavior. The husband, who had visible injuries from being hit with a brick, reached the police but decided to reconcile without filing a formal complaint. The couple has been struggling with frequent disputes due to the husband's drinking habit.

title: Google VP John Casey‚Äôs answer to ‚Äòmost-voted‚Äô question at Google Town Hall
content: Google employees express frustration over reduced pay packages for 2025, questioning smaller increases despite strong financial performance. The company explains the cuts are strategic, calibrating pay to local markets. CEO Sundar Pichai stresses the need for the company to move faster amid increased competition and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Dramatic lightning illuminates Washington skies as thunderstorms roll in
content: Severe thunderstorms with hail, lightning, and heavy rain hit Western Washington and Oregon on Wednesday night, causing urban flooding and power outages. Lightning damaged structures and interrupted services, while precautionary measures were taken by schools and military installations. A severe weather watch was issued, marking a significant event for the region.

title: RBI looks to double investment limit for foreign individuals, says report
content: The Reserve Bank of India aims to double investment limits for individual foreign investors in listed firms to 10%, with a view to enhance capital inflows. This move, confirmed by senior officials, seeks to extend privileges formerly exclusive to overseas Indians.

title: Akhilesh‚Äôs ‚Äòfragrance vs stench‚Äô remark sparks political row, BJP hits back
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticized the BJP for focusing on cowsheds while emphasizing his party's efforts to build perfume parks. Yadav's remarks, accusing the BJP of preferring 'foul smell' over 'fragrance,' have sparked controversy, with the BJP accusing him of insulting Hindu beliefs.

title: Trump warns Canada, EU of higher tariffs if they ‚Äòharm‚Äô US economy
content: President Trump has warned the European Union and Canada of increased tariffs if they collaborate to harm the U.S. economy. He announced a 25% tariff on auto imports, aimed at boosting domestic manufacturing. Experts warn this move could hike production costs and vehicle prices, impacting middle- and working-class families significantly.

title: IPL SRH vs LSG: Team prediction, pitch report and more
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad's impressive 44-run victory over Rajasthan Royals, scoring 286 runs, set a high benchmark for the IPL season. As they prepare to face Lucknow Super Giants, SRH's aggressive approach remains unchanged. With key LSG bowlers injured, SRH‚Äôs top order, including Ishan Kishan and Travis Head, pose a significant threat in today's match.

title: Tata Motors shares plunge 6% as Trump announces 25% auto tariffs
content: Tata Motors shares fell by 6.31% following President Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on imported cars. The United States, a significant market for Jaguar Land Rover, contributes 22% of its total sales. The impending tariffs could necessitate price adjustments and efficiency measures.

title: 'Special 26' turns real: 5 CISF officers held for posing as I-T officers
content: Five CISF personnel, pretending to be income tax officers, were arrested along with three accomplices for a heist in Bengal. The gang, orchestrated by a CISF inspector in collusion with the victim's stepmother, raided a home, seizing cash and jewelry. All accused have been suspended and are under investigation.

title: Canada's Liberal Party bars MP from running under party‚Äôs banner for India ties
content: Canada‚Äôs Liberal Party revoked Indian-origin MP Chandra Arya‚Äôs bid for the party leadership and his nomination in his own constituency due to alleged ties with the Indian government, including undisclosed meetings with Indian officials. Arya denies these allegations and cites his opposition to the Khalistan movement as a possible reason.

title: US cancels 2,000 visa appointments made by ‚Äòbots‚Äô
content: The United States is cracking down on bots blocking visa interview appointments in India, forcing applicants to pay agents up to Rs 35,000 for timely slots. The US embassy has cancelled about 2,000 bot-made appointments and is suspending the associated accounts‚Äô scheduling privileges to combat fraud.

title: UP farmer fights to bring back wife sold by her father for Rs 50k
content: A farmer from Kheri district alleges his pregnant wife was sold by her parents to a man in Sitapur. He claims his wife was forcibly made to terminate her pregnancy and sold against her will. Police registered a case after the DGP's intervention, despite the alleged political influence of his wife's father. The investigation is ongoing.

title: 'Political black comedy at its darkest': Stalin slams Yogi's 'hate' remark
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin criticizes UP CM Yogi Adityanath for his comments on the three-language policy and delimitation, accusing the BJP of being rattled by Tamil Nadu's stance. Stalin emphasizes opposition to the imposition of Hindi and calls for dignity and justice.

title: Bombs hurled, shots fired outside BJP leader's house in West Bengal
content: Unidentified individuals hurled bombs and opened fire outside BJP leader Arjun Singh's residence in Bhatpara, causing injuries to a youth. Singh accused TMC councillor Sunita Singh's son of the attack, while TMC's Jagaddal MLA accused Singh's group of instigating violence. Police and RAF personnel were deployed to restore order, finding empty cartridges and live bombs on-site.

title: Trump announces 25% tariffs on imported cars: How it may help Musk and Tesla
content: US President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on all imported vehicles and key auto parts, impacting Tesla and other automakers. Although Tesla assembles its cars in the US, it relies on foreign parts, increasing production costs. Analysts predict price hikes and reduced vehicle production across North America, exacerbating Tesla's market challenges amid rising competition.

title: ‚ÄòTense relationship serves neither side‚Äô: Jaishankar on India-China ties
content: India and China are striving to mend ties post the 2020 Galwan valley clashes, with some issues still outstanding. External affairs minister S Jaishankar emphasized the significance of managing differences constructively, noting that peace at the border is crucial for the overall relationship between the two nations.

title: Nitesh wins bronze in Greco Roman at Asian Wrestling C'ships
content: Indian wrestler Nitesh earned a bronze medal in the Greco-Roman category at the Senior Asian Wrestling Championship 2025 in Amman, Jordan. His impressive 9-0 victory over Amanberdi Agamammedov of Turkmenistan added to the bronze earlier secured by Sunil Kumar in the men's 87kg division, highlighting India's strong performance in the championship.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens flat; Nifty50 below 23,500
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Thursday. While BSE Sensex was near 77,300, Nifty50 was below 23,500.

title: Personal information of Trump's security officials found online: Report
content: The personal and sensitive information of senior advisers in Trump's administration, including mobile numbers, email addresses, and passwords, have been leaked online. This data, connected to various digital platforms, could be used for phishing attacks and cyber threats, highlighting significant security risks.

title: Gold smuggling case: DRI arrests K'taka businessman who 'helped' Ranya Rao
content: The DRI has arrested Ballari-based jeweller Sahil Sakariya Jain for his involvement in an extensive gold smuggling racket with Sandalwood actor Ranya Rao. Sahil aided Ranya in smuggling 14.5 kg of gold, resulting in a significant financial loss to the exchequer. Investigations revealed frequent communications and assistance in disposing of the smuggled gold.

title: 'B‚Äôdesh Liberation War shared history‚Äô: PM Modi pens letter to Yunus
content: Prime Minister Modi congratulated Bangladesh on their National Day, emphasizing the importance of mutual sensitivity to each other's interests. This comes ahead of their meeting at the Bimstec summit. External affairs minister S Jaishankar hinted a bilateral meeting during the summit is under consideration. President Murmu also echoed the commitment to strong, multifaceted relations with Bangladesh.

title: Cricket players' body report questions ICC revenue distribution
content: World Cricketers' Association raises questions over functioning of cricket but evades direct "on-record" questions on the findings of the report

title: 'Dumped body in manhole': Priest gets life for killing aspiring actor
content: A priest, Iyyagari Venkata Sai Krishna, was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering aspiring TV actress, Kuruganti Apsara, in June 2023. He bludgeoned her to death and concealed her body in a sealed manhole. The court fined him Rs 10 lakh.

title: Gavaskar questions if Gambhir will emulate Dravid
content: Sunil Gavaskar highlights Rahul Dravid's decision to share prize money equally among his support staff after the T20 World Cup, questioning if current coach Gautam Gambhir will do the same following the Champions Trophy win. Gavaskar praised BCCI's generous financial rewards for players and staff, demonstrating appreciation for their efforts.

title: Watch: Masked ICE agents detain Turkish student over pro-Palestine activism
content: A Turkish doctoral student, Rumeysa Ozturk, was detained by federal immigration agents due to her pro-Palestinian activism. With a valid student visa, Ozturk's arrest and subsequent transfer to Louisiana have drawn scrutiny and legal challenges, citing potential violations of her rights and court orders.

title: 'Jitni umar likhi hai ... ': Salman on death threats from Lawrence Bishnoi
content: Salman Khan has reacted to death threats while he's promoting his upcoming movie 'Sikandar' which is set to release on Eid, March 30. It sees him alongside Rashmika Mandanna.

title: Cattle block Delhi CM‚Äôs convoy in Delhi, she steps out to inspect situation
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's convoy was delayed for 15 minutes on a Delhi flyover due to stray cattle. She instructed the development department to provide shelter for the cattle and initiated a policy to relocate stray cattle citywide. Rs 40 crore has been allocated for a modern cow shelter in Ghumanhera village.

title: 'Have already spent Rs 80 lakh': Cop holds revolver at wife‚Äôs head, demands dowry
content: A police sub-inspector, Kishore, his parents, and brother-in-law have been booked for threatening Kishore's wife with a service revolver over dowry demands. Kishore allegedly beat her regularly and demanded Rs 10 lakh for better posting and monthly payments of Rs 50,000 from her parents.

title: Trump signs 25% auto tariff order; markets slump, allies consider countermeasures
content: US president Donald Trump signed an executive order imposing a 25% tariff on foreign-manufactured vehicles, effective from April 2. The move has triggered threats of retaliation from trading partners, with significant impacts already seen in Asian automotive markets. Japan and Canada are evaluating counter-measures, while additional trade levies are expected next week.

title: Punjab to hold first-ever census on drug addiction
content: The AAP government in Punjab plans to conduct its first-ever census to gather data on drug addiction, de-addiction centres, and the socio-economic status of affected individuals. In the 'Badalda Punjab Budget,' the government aims to enhance health insurance coverage and combat cross-border drug smuggling, with a projected debt of almost Rs 4.2 lakh crore.

title: India, China meet again, discuss ways to address ‚Äòpriority areas‚Äô
content: Indian and Chinese officials continued their discussions in Beijing to restart dialogue mechanisms and improve bilateral relations. Both sides agreed to enhance people-to-people exchanges, including direct flights and media interactions. Plans to resume the Kailash Manasarovar Yatra in 2025 were also advanced.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk: 'No more loans to...' as DOGE fights loan fraud
content: Elon Musk supports the new SBA policy to prevent fraud involving stolen Social Security numbers, requiring applicants‚Äô date of birth for direct loans. Measures include halting loans for those under 18 or over 120 years old, addressing past fraudulent cases and improving data integrity in federal loan programs.

title: Women's Sweet 16 rankings: UConn is No. 1, USC holds tight at No. 4
content: uConn beat south Dakota State in the 2025 women's NCAA tournament . a torn ACL in her right knee is a season-ending injury . americans haven't reached the regionals, but there is plenty of movement in the rankings .

title: "Black Comedy At Its Darkest": MK Stalin's Reply To Yogi Adityanath's Barbs
content: In a sharp reply to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's criticism over the three-language row, his Tamil Nadu counterpart MK Stalin has said the firebrand leader's remarks are not irony, but "political black comedy at its darkest"

title: Leaked Conversation Reveals Top Trump Officials' Plan For Strikes On Houthis
content: The screenshots of the chat on the "Houthi PC small group" showed top US officials discussing the time of strikes and types of planes used against Houthis.

title: "Jitni Umar Likhi Hai...": Salman Khan On Lawrence Bishnoi Death Threats
content: Speaking out on the continuous death threats he has been receiving, Bollywood superstar Salman Khan has said his life is in the hands of God

title: "We Remain Committed...": PM Modi's Letter To Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus
content: Amid frosty ties between Delhi and Dhaka, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has written to Muhammad Yunus, chief advisor to Bangladesh's interim government, wishing him on his country's Independence Day

title: "Stop Being A Stooge": Kunal Kamra vs T-Series Over E Shinde Parody Video
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra has sparked massive controversy over jokes targeting Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

title: "Sh***y War Plans": Pentagon Chief Raps The Atlantic Over "Leaked" Chat
content: In the leaked chat, Pete Hegseth revealed details including the times of strikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels and the type of aircraft, missiles and drones used.

title: Video: Moment When Student Was Picked Up By US Officials From Boston Street
content: Federal authorities have detained an international student studying at Tufts University near Boston and have revoked their visa, the university said in a statement Tuesday night.

title: Naked Woman Goes On Stabbing, Biting Rampage At US Airport
content: The woman, who was reportedly experiencing a "manic episode," was seen walking naked through the airport, claiming to be the goddess Venus.

title: "Amused": Nirmala Sitharaman As AAP's Raghav Chadha Flags Bank Conditions
content: Nirmala Sitharaman, in a friendly banter, said that Raghav Chadha's exposure to the western world would help people within the country.

title: Opinion: Three-Language Row And Some Hard Facts You Can't Wish Away
content: Questions of regional identity are the reason that states assert their autonomy in educational policies. We can't wish this reality away.

title: KKR Told To Move Out Of Kolkata Amid 'Pitch' Row: "They're Paying For..."
content: Kolkata Knight Riders team management was left disappointed with the surface at Eden Gardens after they were beaten by Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL 2025 opener.

title: "Insult To Life Itself": Ghibli Founder Hayao Miyazaki On AI-Generated Art
content: If you have been active on social media, particularly X, in the last 24 hours, it may give you the impression that it's a Studio Ghibli world, and we are living in it. It all has come about, courtesy of OpenAI's latest image-generation update.

title: Major Update On Rohit Sharma's Captaincy: Report Says "Modest Outings..."
content: Rohit Sharma will be leading the Indian cricket team in the upcoming Test series against England despite his poor show in Australia, according to a report.

title: After Delays, US Aerospace Delivers First F-404 Engines For Tejas MK-1A Jets
content: The F404-IN20 engine is a tailored design for India's single-engine fighter programme with the highest thrust within the F404 family and a higher-flow fan, unique single-crystal turbine blades, and numerous special components.

title: Why Social Media Is Suddenly Flooded With Studio Ghibli-Style Art
content: From watercolour-like landscapes to hand-drawn character portraits, the internet seems to have transformed into a scene from Spirited Away or Howl's Moving Castle.

title: Opinion: Can I Have A 'Non-Sexual' Mascara, Please?
content: Ever tried a blush called 'Orgasm'? Or a mascara that struts its stuff with the moniker, 'Better than Sex'? Sex sells. Brands know that all too well. Even if that means reducing women to mere sex objects.

title: Already 2-0, Dodgers are the center of the spectacle on Opening Day
content: the Dodgers underperform this season . he faced his worst fear: nothing to do and nowhere to go . his teammate and winning pitcher was at the front of the room, sitting at a table and answering questions with expansive answers .

title: MLB predictions: From playoffs and World Series to MVPs and Cy Youngs
content: a comic book rendition of the biggest storylines of the upcoming Major League Baseball season gets underway tomorrow with Opening Day baseball . 28 of ESPN's MLB writers, analysts and editors on the spot to predict what will happen in baseball this year . a number of our voters have asked their voters to explain their opinions .

title: Drake Maye gets No. 1 WR: Stefon Diggs immediately improves Patriots' offense
content: Stefon Diggs agrees on a three-year, $69 million contract with $26 million guaranteed . he's the best the Patriots have, a competitor and a worthy risk for the team to take . diggs' rehab is on course, and he is expected to be ready for Week 1 .

title: If Aaron Rodgers balks, what are Pittsburgh's prospects at quarterback?
content: the Pittsburgh Steelers have two quarterbacks on their roster as they await a decision from four-time NFL MVP Aaron Rodgers . despite the car wash of conversations, rodgers left Pittsburgh without agreeing to a deal . the former Jet and Packer is seemingly operating without a deadline even as his options narrow .

content: comedian had sought time to appear before the cops by April 3 . but police sources said no more time could be provided . he faces multiple charges, including defamation and statements conducing to public mischief . the comic sang a parody of 'Bholi Si Surat' song from 1997 blockbuster .
